Error Troubleshooting

Timeout

A timeout is normally caused by the mgmt instance being inaccessible. Check your connection, and if using a VPN, make sure you did not log out.

Forbidden (403)

This is caused by a lack of permissions. You may need to log in to be able to complete the requested action.

Service Unavailable (503/0)

There are many probable causes, some of which are not related to the user instance. Try reloading the page, checking the URL, and if the problem persists, try again later or contact the developer.

Botched CSV imports

Please check if the uploaded file adheres to the requested format. It must contain at least one column (two for renaming operations), and each new PV must belong to a new row.

Other errors

Some other errors could arise during normal utilization. Please check you have the certificate for the address you're visiting added as an exception to your browser, and that you have not cleared any important browser information. In general, a page reload should suffice.

General Information

Behavior

The selected operation is applied to every listed PV, separated by commas. Spaces are ignored, in order to avoid errors. In case one PV fails, the requested operation will still be performed (or attempted) for every other listed PV.

Request order

Requests are sent in batches in order to speed up execution. Therefore, the processed PVs count may increase by more than one PV at once. In order to determine what shall be done with each specific PV, a preliminary status check occurs (displayed as "Fetching PV Listing...").

Undoing

All operations are final, especially deletions, as they take miliseconds to perform. Once you click apply, it should be understood that you cannot cancel the operation midway, considering the execution time. Be careful, especially with deletions.

Reporting Problems

For unexpected errors that you believe are not related to your end, please contact the developer. Useful information can be found in the console (F12 key), adding an image of what the console looks like at the time of execution facilitates reproducing problems while developing. If possible, add your browser, OS and what you were trying to do at the time.
